events.title: Ficino translates Corpus Hermeticum
events.description: Cosimo de' Medici commissions Marsilio Ficino to translate the newly discovered Greek manuscripts

events.title: First printed Ficino translations
events.description: Ficino's translations of Plato and Hermes begin circulating in print

events.title: Pico's 900 Theses
events.description: Giovanni Pico della Mirandola proposes a grand synthesis including Christian Kabbalah

events.title: Reuchlin studies Kabbalah
events.description: Johannes Reuchlin begins his pioneering work on Christian Kabbalah

events.title: Reuchlin's De Arte Cabalistica
events.description: First systematic Christian Kabbalistic text published

events.title: Erasmus's Greek New Testament
events.description: Humanist textual scholarship meets religious reform

events.title: Luther's 95 Theses
events.description: The Reformation begins, reshaping religious publishing

events.title: Agrippa's De Occulta Philosophia
events.description: Heinrich Cornelius Agrippa publishes the encyclopedia of Renaissance magic

events.title: Paracelsus's major works appear
events.description: Theophrastus Paracelsus challenges Galenic medicine

events.title: Death of Paracelsus
events.description: Paracelsus dies; posthumous publications flood the market

events.title: Plantin Press established
events.description: Christopher Plantin founds his press in Antwerp, major publisher of esoterica

events.title: John Dee's Monas Hieroglyphica
events.description: English magus publishes his hieroglyphic synthesis

events.title: Paracelsianism spreads
events.description: Peak decade for Paracelsian medical publishing

events.title: Giordano Bruno in England
events.description: Bruno lectures at Oxford, promotes Hermetic cosmology

events.title: Bruno burned at the stake
events.description: Giordano Bruno executed in Rome for heresy

events.title: Fama Fraternitatis published
events.description: First Rosicrucian manifesto appears anonymously in Kassel

events.title: Confessio Fraternitatis
events.description: Second Rosicrucian manifesto; Europe debates the Brotherhood's existence

events.title: Chemical Wedding of Christian Rosenkreutz
events.description: Johann Valentin Andreae publishes the allegorical romance

events.title: Rosicrucian furor peaks
events.description: 28 Rosicrucian-related publications this year alone

events.title: Thirty Years War begins
events.description: Religious conflict engulfs Europe; intellectual networks disrupted

events.title: Robert Fludd's defense of Rosicrucianism
events.description: English physician publishes elaborate Hermetic cosmology

events.title: Boehme's Aurora published
events.description: Jacob Boehme's visionary writings begin circulating

events.title: Boehme's works spread
events.description: English translations of Boehme appear; theosophy gains momentum

events.title: Peace of Westphalia
events.description: End of Thirty Years War; esoteric publishing recovers

events.title: English Hermetica translations
events.description: Thomas Vaughan and others translate Hermetic texts into English

events.title: Vaughan's Anthroposophia Theomagica
events.description: Thomas Vaughan publishes his Hermetic synthesis

events.title: Boehme peak in Dutch
events.description: Major Dutch editions of Jacob Boehme appear

events.title: Alchemy publishing peak
events.description: Highest single-year output for alchemical texts

events.title: Alchemy reaches 22 works
events.description: Peak year for alchemical publishing in the BPH catalog

events.title: Peak Boehme/mysticism year
events.description: 32 mysticism and 28 theosophy publications - highest convergence

events.title: Mysticism dominates
events.description: 37 mysticism publications - genre reaches its apex

events.title: Late mysticism/theosophy surge
events.description: 34 mysticism and 27 theosophy works - final major convergence
